results.title: Trois Milliards Sans Ascenseur
results.creator_credit: Roger Pigaut, Andre Cohen, Eugene Lepicier and Marcel Sebaoun
results.brief_description:
Five friends living in a blue-collar neighborhood which is being demolished to make way for a new office and housing development band together to save their neighborhood and get rich along the way. They set up on a complicated plot involving both jewel theft and insurance fraud. Things get even more complicated when they call for the services of an expert burglar.

Credits: Producers, Andre Cohen, Marcel Sebaoun, Eugene Lepicier ; director, Roger Pigaut ; writers, Roger Pigaut, Andre G. Brunelin ; photography, Jean Tournier ; music, Teo Usuelli.
Cast: Serge Reggiani, Michel Bouquet, Francoise Rosay, Bernard Fresson, Dany Carrel, Amidou, Gabriele Ferzetti, Marcel Bozzuffi, Victor Lanoux, Nike Arrighi.

results.title: Trial on the Road
results.brief_description: Lazarev is a German soldier who is captured by a young and raw Russian partisan. Lazarev is himself Russian and had enlisted in the German forces when they had over-run his land. Lazarev’s initial test of loyalty comes when he is able to trick some German offices and overpower them. Finally his trial of loyalty is put to one supreme test when he is asked to lead a group attempting to hijack a train.

results.title: Trafficopter
results.brief_description: A view of Montreal as seen from the helicopter of one of the radio stations that reports on rush-hour traffic movement. Spread out below are the ant-runs of the city—freeways, interchanges, bridges, downtown arteries—and on them the thousands of vehicles, like so many dinky-toys, moving with the flow or jammed in massive tie-ups. It is a seething, teeming spectacle, a unique view of the city, artfully filmed, with comments by the traffic guide, Len Rowcliffe.

results.title: Toy story (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: John Lasseter, Bonnie Arnold, Ralph Guggenheim, Pixar Animation Studios and Walt Disney Pictures
results.brief_description: Awarded a special Academy Award for Special Achievement, this fully animated adventure is riotous fun for kids of all ages. When a draw-stringed cowboy named Woody, his boy’s favourite toy, is replaced one birthday by the latest toy - a flashy new space-ranger named Buzz Lightyear, it sparks an outrageous tiff between toys. Accidentally whisked away from home and into the clutches of the neighbourhood bully, these two squabbling rivals must work together as a team if they are to escape. Visual wizardry, uproarious laughs and the coolest characters ever assembled transform the world’s first computer-animated feature film into an incomparable movie marvel.

results.title: Toot, whistle, plunk and boom
results.brief_description: Animated cartoons show the origin and development of musical instruments. Professor Owl tells his class how all music comes from a toot (the horns), whistle (woodwinds), plunk (strings) and boom (percussion). Explains how the complex instruments of the modern symphony orchestra and brass band developed from primitive forms and the effect of various refinements such as the valves on the brass horn.

results.title: Titsiana Booberini
results.creator_credit: Robert Luketic and Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television
results.brief_description: Innovative, highly amusing tale of the ugly duckling who turns into a swan. Tania Lacy shines as the very plain, painfully shy and awkward shop assistant who has a crush on the Store Manager. Sophie Lee is equally as good as the bitchy beautiful shop assistant who gets everything her way. Presented as a musical, with ballet-like dance sequences, this quirky film is a classic tale which shows that beauty is, after all, only skin deep. Titsiana’s singing voice is provided by Sarah Liversidge.

results.title: THX 1138
results.creator_credit: George Lucas, Lawrence Sturhahn and American Zoetrope
results.brief_description: A future society of sophisticated technology in a subterranean city. Each individual has a number, not a name. Human responses and inclinations are suppressed by constant surveillance, robot policeman, and a diet of tranquiliser drugs. A couple break the rules, conceive a child and are put in prison where they meet a man who claims to know an escape route. Starring Robert Duvall, Donald Pleasence and Maggie McOmie.

results.title: The Violinist
results.brief_description: An animated spoof of the old saying - to create great music the artist must suffer. Harry, the street violinist, makes music which dismays even his own dog. He tries everything, including music lessons but his music does not improve until he takes advice and begins to suffer.

results.title: The Tenant
results.creator_credit: Roman Polanski, Andrew Braunsberg and Marianne Productions
results.brief_description: Based on the novel by Richard Topor, “The Tenant” is a psychological horror film by Roman Polanski which can also be read as a deeply disturbed personal work about a man’s disintegration in the face of death and tragedy. (There are obvious parallels to be drawn by the mental disintegration of the film’s main character, Trelkovsky - played by Polanski himself - to the crisis suffered by the director when his wife and unborn child were brutally slaughtered by the infamous Charles Manson cult). Polanski’s work from the beginning of his career has seen him play mischievously and surrealistically with the themes of mental illness, hauntings and transvestitism, but in “The Tenant”, the whole world which Trelkovsky inhabits seems to be riddled with varying degrees of evil and repressed violence. He is a new tenant in an old Baroque Parisian hotel and the last occupant in his room attempted suicide by jumping from the building. Trelkovsky meets her on the day of her death: the memory of her anguished screaming will reverberate with him for the rest of his life. The cast includes Isabelle Adjani, Melvyn Douglas, Shelley Winters and Lila Kedrova, and the sombre lighting and cinematography is by noted Swedish cinematographer, Sven Nykvist. As always, Polanski proves an effective and imaginative master of the horror genre. Note: “The Tenant” is a USA/French co-production in which the French actors are dubbed into English.

results.title: The Tale of Ruby Rose
results.brief_description: Set amid the austere beauty of Tasmania’s mountainous landscape, The Tale of Ruby Rose is a portrait of a family alone in the wilderness and one woman’s strength to overcome an intense fear of the dark. Driven by her husband’s indifference to her fear, Ruby makes the hazardous trip across the mountains to the village of her birth in the lowlands. There, with her grandmother, she comes to terms with her terror of the elements. Cast: Melita Jurisic, Chris Haywood, Rod Zuanic, Martyn Sanderson, Sheila Florance.
